articles.title: Who we are
articles.articleTitle: MHI in the UK is part of a global McKinsey initiative to serve hospitals in a new way — recognising that it takes time truly to transform the performance of any hospital
articles.colLeft:
The MHI initiative is being implemented in four countries – the US, Germany, France and the UK –and each country is applying a different mix of data analysis, capability building and change management. In the UK, the mix has been specifically tailored to the NHS.

MHI UK improvement programmes typically comprise three phases:
articles.colRight: Diagnostic phase – applying tools to help understand performance and organisational health; Design phase – constructing solutions for definable improvement; and Delivery phase – achieving impact through a combination of capability building and intervention. We also bring together these approaches, and share knowledge and perspectives, through MHI Improvement Communities of member hospitals.

articles.title: Why we are different
articles.articleTitle: What's distinctive about our approach is that we create a true partnership with hospital leaders to achieve transformation.
articles.colLeft: Hospitals who engage us become effectively our 'shareholders,' setting our priorities, shaping the way we work, and most importantly identifying the improvement challenges they each want
articles.colRight: to address as a priority. We also commit to work at a pace determined by the hospital leadership – but with sufficient momentum to ensure impact and deliver results.

team.description:
John, a senior expert in McKinsey's healthcare team, leads the development of MHI in the UK.

He joined the MHI team in April 2010, having previously worked in a number of hospital operational and strategic roles in the NHS and private sector. Neil has extensive practical hospital management experience gained over the last 17 years. This has included day-to-day responsibility for the performance of hospital clinical services, managing complex service and strategic change, and the development of hospital commercial strategies.
